active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a zero-trust deployment environment, debate the merits of CRL versus OCSP for certificate revocation. Consider real-world pitfalls like CRL distribution delays during DDoS attacks and how they impact MITM prevention. Support your position with evidence from NIST SP 800-57 or CA/B Forum BR.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Certificate Management (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > SDLC > 009_Deployment and Release > Environment Hardening > Certificate Management). Voter consensus: 84.3% approval on pedagogy, completeness, clarity. Use provided research context, sources (CA/B BR: https://cabforum.org/baseline-requirements-documents/, NIST SP 800-57pt1r5: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-57pt1r5.pdf, NIST SP 1800-16: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.1800-16.pdf), definitions (Digital Cert, PKI, CA, RA, CRL, OCSP, TLS), big picture (trust in hardened envs, anti-MITM, zero-trust), prerequisites (crypto basics, TLS, SDLC), concept map, pitfalls (e.g., CRL latency, weak CAs). Incorporate these EXACT learning objectives [insert learning_objectives array], active learning [insert active_learning], scaffolding layers [insert scaffolding_layers]. Generate flashcards per schema [insert flashcard_schema]: 50 cards, balanced, Anki format (Front || Back). Questions progress scaffolding layers. Use distractors per protocol. Tie explanations to objectives/layers/active learning. Ensure university pedagogy: Bloom's progression, active recall. Output ONLY a numbered list of flashcards.
